New Records: Glenn Maxwell broke the record for the fastest century in Cricket World Cup history, smashing Aiden Markram's previous mark of 49 with a 40-ball ton
Key Match Events: Australia made 399-8 and Netherlands were skittled for 90
Glenn Maxwell smashed nine fours and eight sixes, whacking the ball to all parts of Delhi's Arun Jaitley Stadium
Pre-Game Insights: Glenn Maxwell was unwell and didn't want to bat before the match
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Maxwell felt he had dispelled any self-doubts he may have had with his dazzling knock
Maxwell said his blistering innings was a huge confidence boost
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dutch bowler Bas de Leede's figures of 2-115 were the most expensive in ODI history
Glenn Maxwell broke his own Australian record for fastest ODI century, set at the 2015 World Cup against Sri Lanka
Others: Glenn Maxwell had a sleepless night with a bug before the match
Maxwell broke his leg in November in a freak accident and missed Australia's recent tour of South Africa with an ankle issue
